description: From Middle English tode, toode, tadde, tade, from Old English *tāde, a shortened variant of Old English tādie, tādiġe (“toad”). Compare Old English tāxe (“toad”).

Cognate with Scots tade, taid, taed, ted (“toad”). Compare also Danish tudse (“toad”), possibly originally from the same prehistoric root; also Swedish tåssa, tossa (“toad”), Old English tāxe (“toad”), Old English tosca (“toad”) by contrast.

entries.meaning: An amphibian, a kind of frog (order Anura) with shorter hindlegs and a drier, wartier skin, many in family Bufonidae.
examples: There's a killer on the road / His brain is squirmin' like a toad

verbs.description: toad (third-person singular simple present toads, present participle toading, simple past and past participle toaded)

entries.meaning: (Internet, informal, transitive) To expel (a user) permanently from a MUD or similar system, so that their account is deleted.
